intro: Spiesia oxyphylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. The plant is typically found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. Spiesia oxyphylla is often used in ornamental gardening due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
